page.title: 05FARMING REDBROOK + DISTRICT
page.content: Information is on 9 of the 11 farms in the area.They vary in{size}from 3 to 392 acres,most are aprox. 100-150 acres.Two of the farms are rented; the rest owned by the farmer.{Labour}on the farm consists only of the farmers and 1-2 members of their families working full or part-time.{The farms {and farmhouses}are all old, many over 400 years.Several of the farms have been in the same families for 40-80 years.{The farm buildings}usually include old stone barns and stock sheds with some newer Dutch barns and a milking parlour.All the farms own a tractor; most own 3-5.Usually they own also a range of other{machines: mowers,harrows, ploughs,balers etc. Many farmers help in{conservation}by keeping untreated hedgerows, woodland areas and streams and ponds unpolluted by insecticides.
